items.q: Who was the primary author of the US Declaration of Independence?
items.explanation: Jefferson drafted the document in 1776, outlining the colonies' reasons for rebelling.

items.q: The French Revolution began with the storming of the Bastille.
items.explanation: The Bastille was a state prison representing royal authority in Paris; it fell on July 14, 1789.

items.q: Winston Churchill was the Prime Minister of the UK during World War I.
items.explanation: He was the Prime Minister during World War II. David Lloyd George led during most of WWI.

items.q: What global organization was formed after World War I to promote international peace?
items.explanation: It was a predecessor to the United Nations, though ultimately failed to prevent WWII.

items.q: Who led the Bolsheviks to power during the Russian Revolution of 1917?
items.explanation: This established the world's first communist state.

items.q: Which two Greek city-states fought the Peloponnesian War?
items.explanation: Sparta ultimately won the conflict, ending Athenian dominance.

items.q: During the Cold War, what was the term for the invisible boundary dividing Europe?
items.explanation: Coined by Winston Churchill, it represented the divide between democratic and communist blocs.

items.q: What famous code of law was established in ancient Babylon?
items.explanation: It is famous for the principle of 'an eye for an eye'.

items.q: Who was the first female Prime Minister of the United Kingdom?
items.explanation: She was known as the 'Iron Lady' for her uncompromising politics.

items.q: In which war did the United States fight against the Viet Cong?
items.explanation: It was a major Cold War proxy conflict.
